de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.parser
Interface CharacterAccess

All Known Subinterfaces:
Scanner
All Known Implementing Classes:
EbnfScanner
interface CharacterAccess

Defines methods to access scanned input stream by characters.

Author:
Sven Strittmatter

Method Summary
 void backupCharacter()
          Decrements the character cursor.
 char getCurrentCharacter()
          Returns the character at the current cursor from the input stream.
 boolean hasNextCharacter()
          Returns if there is a next character in the input stream.
 void nextCharacter()
          Increments the character cursor.
 char peekCharacter()
          Returns next character without advancing the cursor.
 

Method Detail

getCurrentCharacter

char getCurrentCharacter()
Returns the character at the current cursor from the input stream.

Returns:
The current character.

hasNextCharacter

boolean hasNextCharacter()
Returns if there is a next character in the input stream.

Returns:
If there is one more character.

nextCharacter

void nextCharacter()
                   throws IOException
Increments the character cursor.

Throws:
IOException - On IO errors caused by the input reader.

backupCharacter

void backupCharacter()
Decrements the character cursor.

peekCharacter

char peekCharacter()
                   throws IOException
Returns next character without advancing the cursor.

Returns:
Returns peeked character.
Throws:
IOException - On IO errors of scanned source.
